title: Really Starting to Hate League.
body:
Every few months of playing League I get to the point where I simply cannot stand the game and the OCE community. I always end up having a few months break and return hoping the game is in a better place but I'm constantly let down. In fact, the last few months to a year I can't help to feel the game has slowly but surely declined.

The community is just rubbish along with the banning system and essentially makes it infuriating for people actually trying to climb. Stats wise I'd say that in roughly 50% if not more of my games I come across and intent feeder or griefer. The remainder games are either you get stomped or you stomp and never result in an even match. How is that meant to be an enjoyable experience and how am I supposed to take this game seriously?

Constantly I feel myself wanting to lash out at people for their idiotic attitudes and outlook on the game. I'll be the first to admit it pisses me off to no end when you get some twat intently feed your lane because they messed up or someone afk's after dying.

Does anyone else feel the same way or can sense the slow but surely decline of the game and it's state?

It's because they balance the game for pro play, so the vast majority who don't have the reactions and gameplay insight as mid-Rank and up players are left with the same handful of dominating champions in every single game that they don't know how to deal with, and a slippery slope of a meta game that they don't know how to climb back up once they fall down. Ironically, once they lose the interest of more casual players — which makes up about 95% of all players — their pro play scene won't be so popular anymore, and they won't be selling enough RP to keep bringing in fresh content and updates.

I've been playing this game a long time but the one sided nature of games and the inability to come back after one lane has snowballed is really starting to piss me off.

Either you mute all or you ignore them .

idk i feel like a lot of my ranked games are pretty even, that's just my experiences i guess

League has reached the point where games are heavily one side and very rarely do close games actually happen, too much broken shit has been introduced over the past few years along with Riot adding massive amounts of cc to new champions (galio/urgot). Every game just becomes frustrating instead of fun, I used to play League every day for the entire day, now I play off and on every once in a while. As someone who has to try and solo carry games out of low elo League has become almost impossible to win for me. I win my lane and I'm always the only person fed on my team. Yet I find it next to impossible to solo carry games. It seemed much easier a little while ago but now League is the most unbalanced its been yet. Riot has to be downright the worst company at balancing I've ever seen in a video game. Just look at duskblade, they introduced lethality, had to nerf it, then buff it again, then tried to change duskblade to make it "better", then it was the most broken item in the game that every champion rushed. Then they hotfixed it, and its STILL op. Who seriously comes up with these ideas? How can you introduce something new to the game but not even get it right the first 3 times? (*cough* RYZE *cough*)

Yes, I do agree with this, that's why I rotate between games, that way I'm bored of that game, and then come back to the LoL game.
But in terms of toxicity, it's very hard to even get used to. It's best to just mute everyone and stick to playing with friends.
